html: While to the righteous Jehovah’s coming is a relief and comfort from the oppression of the wicked, to the wicked it is a terrifying ordeal (v 19; Isaiah 25:9; 35:3-4; 66:13-16). Two conditions thus lead up to Jehovah coming: (1) the wickedness of the wicked reaching a point that justifies their destruction; and (2) the righteousness of the righteous—those who prove faithful to Jehovah under all conditions—reaching a point that requires their deliverance. “Dust,” a chaos motif, describes the final, de-created state of the wicked who both “hide” and end up there (Isaiah 26:5; 29:5; 41:2; 47:1-2).
